intro: Pachycymbium abayense, commonly known as the Philippine water lily, is a rare aquatic plant native to the Philippines. It is characterized by its broad, floating leaves and showy white flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and lakes. Its leaves are thick and waxy, adapted to support the weight of water and provide buoyancy. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
